ygData.subject: Call her the Lone Raptor

Subject: Call her the Lone Raptor
Message-ID: <8rbbnk+ib8g@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2082
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: wilddance_mare@...

Cyber Claw:




The snow was deep up to Cyber Claw's chest in beast mode. She had a 
pelt drapped over her back. Artifical skin and metal weren't well at 
keeping the heat in. She traveled miles from Africa where she had 
been put on-line, to a cold, bitter land of ice and snow. It was the 
only place she found safe away from her own kind. But as always, she 
couldn't escape her memories. Her treachery. 

She walked on, her temperature core working at their most. He claws 
slipped over a sheet of ice below the snow, stumbling slightly. After 
two more steps, the ice collapsed, dropping the velociraptor several 
feet down a pit. She landed on her side, with a fur pelt over head 
head. She snarled.

He lurched to her feet and tossed her head about until she threw the 
pelt off. He looked around. She found herself in an underground ice 
cavern. She bared her teeth and looked up. That was simple. She had a 
flight mode. She could always fly out.

But why not explore? She may find something interesting. She walked 
down the crevasse, watching the blue and white glistening ice and 
snow.

She went on until she came across erected stalactmites of ice. She 
saw it as rather beautiful. She walked to them, looking at her 
distorted reflection. She tilted her head. A light flickered inside 
the ice stalactmite. She bared her teeth at it. 

A male voice echoed through the cavern. Cyber Claw hissed and jumped. 
She thrashed her tail feriously. It wasn't of the Predacon language 
nor the Maximal language.

She transformed to robot mode, and withdrew her fighting staff. She 
waited for something to happen, and it did. Something busted out of 
the icy ground and grabbed her ankles. She looked down. There were 
four wires. She hissed at them and activated her flight mode. The 
wires held onto her. 

The wires suddenly threw her, further down the cavern. She shook her 
head, her face held in a harsh glare like her male double. Again, the 
wires broke out from the ice and grabbed her. She tried to fly again, 
but it pulled her. It pulled her into the next section.
